channel.title: Markov chains IRC bot
channel.description:
This is something that I whipped up a week ago or so, I'm surprised it actually works. It implements [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markov_chain]Markov chains[/url] (at least I think it does, if it doesn't it's something very similar in function). I'm too lazy to explain the specifics of the process, I'm sure you can figure it out :). If you have any questions post here.
ALSOALSO, this uses saevion's directed graph implementation, so credits to him!
And just another note, the IRC module is by NO means finished, I only coded it until it functioned as I needed it to. As you can see there are a few half-assedly implemented functions, feel free to expand on it.

item.title: Markov chains IRC bot
item.dc:creator: @White_Castle White Castle
item.description:
@White_Castle wrote:

I dunno how I managed to upload something other than the actual Markov chains bot, I guess I shoulda been tipped off by regex talking about a lexer… Anyhow! The real Markov chains bot I made is now uploaded, try it! Just try to not annoy #mopar too awfully much :).

Read full topic

item.title: Markov chains IRC bot
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

1337h4x:

Too lazy to fuck with winrar, it refuses to open .rar’s unless I force it, but how are makarow chains supposed to improve the irc bot?

It is a type of more advanced AI, check out the quotes from monty:

http://www.jibble.org/montyquotes.php

If you are interested in using it, someone already wrote a package called JMegaHal http://www.jibble.org/jmegahal/

I remember seeing an awesome applet on jibble.org that graphically illustrated what markov chains really do, but I can’t seem to find it right now…

edit:

Just found the applet: http://www.jibble.org/dynamicgraph.php Pretty nifty stuff.

Read full topic
